page.title: 05A DAY IN A DOCTOR'S LIFE
page.content: {A.M: 8.00}Calls at hospital to see own patients -maternity/geriatric.{8.30}At Health Centre -looks through mai1. {8.45}Surgery: 1 patient every 7 mins, by appointment.{10.15}coffee and case conferences with nurses and health visitors.{10.45}Home visits (a) urgent calls (b) regular calls e.g. elderly with arthritis/diabetes.{12.30}Lunch break.{P.M.}More home and hospital visits + 2 hour appointment surgery. Take turn at "emergency surgery" (non-appointment) twice per week.{ In {addition:}Dr.is "on call" 11pm-7am one night per week & every 2nd weekend Usually have 2/3 calls at night. Dr. takes share in hospital casualty and maternity wards. Dr's role in Surgery (a){Prescribing:}frequently antibiotic or painkilling drugs (b){Advice:}focus on preventive health care -not smoking or not being overweight.
